title: Players attitude on tilt
body: So I've noticed over quite a lot of games recently that attitude of some players when they have lost lane and have tilted. So we will enter a game and there is a pretty positive environment, everyone saying "glhf" and all and joking around about stuff. Then we move on to the early-mid game and the people you knew from the start of the game are completely different. Someone will be 1/3 and spamming ff as much as he can because he believes the game is over and theres 0 chance of us winning. But sometimes its not just "someone", its the other 4 people who 3 of which aren't even tilted, but because of this stupid idiot who is crying because his lane didn't go his way he's putting that 100% effort into trying to convince the other 3 that theres no hope. Theres nothing you can do because 4 against 1 the game is forfeited and you get a free loss. The attitude of some of these players makes me cry {{item:3151}}

replies.body: If they focus on what they need to do to win the game, it would do a hell of lot more good than whine or say "ff@20". If they don't know what to do they should ask their team for help.
And how often does the team give them proper, constructive help that actually turns the game around for that one struggling player?

If they are bad players then not often. But there might be a good player in their team that is actually trying to win, that does give good advice. You don't know until you try. Better try than feed.

If you want to win that is.

losing lane doesn't make you tilted.
tilt is not this one game phenomenon, tilt is poor judgement and bad gameplay over a large series of games.
tilt is going from plat 2 59 lp to plat 4 23 lp without winning a single game. tilt is a 20 game lose streak. tilt is not "oh I lost lane, I'm tilting" or "I fucked up and got caught out, I'm tilting". fuck off.

this is happened to me today when i started off having ping spikes to 800 and was missing every blitz pull, we had lost lane by the time i fixed it and then basically the enemy jungler capitilized on this and camped bot and i was tilted as fuck because losing lane to lag or dcing gets to me more so then being outskilled, but i didnt give up when me and my adc could have cried ff at 10-15 and we ended up winning.

people just need to realise games are decided in the first 15 minutes if you let them be and comebacks are real.

http://boards.oce.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/gameplay-strategy/7f2OtAPh-ranked-bronze-4-attitude

I made a post this morning about a similar topic. It's quite frustrating to see bad attitudes so early in the game, when it is possible to still win - even when the odds are against you.

The feels are real.

{{item:3151}}
It's no different in challenjour. i am here to dispell the myth of "elo heaven"

thats why they are at bronze rank. they will not be able to climb up being stuck there and wondering why other players are bad without realising that he is the only common denominator of his losing streaks.
